newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Cocoa seen inching towards 1,060 target.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Cocoa seen inching towards 1,060 target.

text.p: JULY Close * Support * Resist * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
LIFFE cocoa futures may finally break out of their recent trading range in the next couple of weeks, technical analysts said.
Although July was called to open two stg a tonne lower, the position had broken a downward trend on the five-day relative strength index (RSI).
That should give it the strength to break initial resistance near 1,035 stg and re-test key resistance near 1,060, said Trevor Neil, senior technical analyst at Union Cal Futures.
The 1,060 level has not been seen since late April.
The break indicated that the slow rise since the beginning of May would extend to 1,060 without much interruption, he said.
July cocoa closed little changed at 1,029, and CSCE July cocoa ended sharply lower at $1,463 after failing to break $1,500 early in the session.
London's July contract has held a wide range between about 1,060 and the April 9 low of 980 since around March and is currently near the middle of that range.
July has previously tested 1,060 twice and failed. But Neil said indicators were pointing to an ultimately successful third attempt.
"Oscillators are in good shape despite the sideways market," he said. "They have created a bullish pattern, which is unusual in a sideways market."
But he said the move toward 1,060 would take time. "It's probably more than five days away," he said.
And when July finally moved up to 1,060, it would be important to see how it reacted.
Neil added that while he was leaning toward a break of 1,060, recent low volume was a discouraging.
"The volume has not really added to the bullish picture," he said.
Immediate July support rested at 1,000, with key support at 980. If July slipped below 980, the market could see a swift move to between 940 and 900.
